body.p: Personally appeared before the undersigned authority. the undersigned P. J. Donham and made oath, that he would support the constitution of the united states and of this state, and that he would Honestly, and impartially, & faithfully execute well and truly and perform well and truly, all the duties enjoined upon him, in pursuance, with the Law of the state of Kentucky, and in compliance with the commission issued to him by B. Magoffen

Governor of the Commonwealth of Kentucky, appointing him the said P J Donham,, a Commissioner of Deeds of the state of ohio, for the period of four years from
and after the 16th day of August AD 1862,,
Sworn to and subscribed by P J Donham before me the undersigned a notary Public, duly authorized to administer oaths within and for said County and state of ohio.
In testimony whereof I have hereunto subscribed my name & affixed my notarial seal on this the 20th day of August AD 1862

P, J. Nicholas
Notary Public
Clermont County
Ohio

James W. Tate Esq
assistant secty &c
Please find the referred affidavit & $500 inclosed if not correct be good enough to give me information
Be good enough to inform me if the afft is filed so that I can execute deeds & c yours

Ohio. --
Comr. of Deeds
Oath
P. J. Donham
Filed Aug 23d 1862
